condition.description:
Coughing is a reflex that keeps your throat and airways clear. Although it can be annoying, coughing helps your body heal or protect itself. Coughs can be either acute or chronic. Acute coughs begin suddenly and usually last no more than 2 to 3 weeks. Acute coughs are the kind you most often get with a cold, flu, or acute bronchitis. Chronic coughs last longer than 2 to 3 weeks. Causes of chronic cough include

  • Chronic bronchitis
  • Asthma
  • Allergies
  • COPD (chronic obstructive pulmonary disease)
  • GERD (gastroesophageal reflux disease)
  • Smoking
  • Throat disorders, such as croup in young children
  • Some medicines

Water can help ease your cough - whether you drink it or add it to the air with a steamy shower or vaporizer. If you have a cold or the flu, antihistamines may work better than non-prescription cough medicines. Children under four should not have cough medicine. For children over four, use caution and read labels carefully.
condition.name: Cough

carousel_items: For children 4 years or older. Follow age-specific dosing instructions on how much to take.
Only use the dosing cup to measure the exact amount of medicine and don't take more than instructed.
Starts working in 30 minutes.
Don't give Children's Sudafed PE Cold and Cough too close to bedtime since phenylephrine, the decongestant, can make your child restless.
Let your child's doctor know if his/her symptoms don't improve in a few days, or if he/she have a really bad sore throat with a fever, headache, nausea, or vomiting.

basics.benefits_moa: Children's Sudafed PE Cold and Cough is a combination medicine that treats cold and flu symptoms. Dextromethorphan is a cough suppressant. Phenylephrine is a decongestant that clears sinuses.
basics.bottom_line: Children's Sudafed PE Cold and Cough relieves stuffy nose, but it could keep your child up at night. Cold and flu medicines should be used only after non-drug options are tried.
downsides: Phenylephrine doesn't last as long as other oral decongestants like Pseudoephedrine.
It may not let your child sleep well, so don't take it too close to bedtime.
Can worsen certain conditions so check with your child's doctor if he/she has heart problems, high blood pressure, high blood sugar, or thyroid problems.

downsides_processed.orig: Phenylephrine doesn't last as long as other oral decongestants like Pseudoephedrine.
It may not let your child sleep well, so don't take it too close to bedtime.
Can worsen certain conditions so check with your child's doctor if he/she has heart problems, high blood pressure, high blood sugar, or thyroid problems.

upsides: Children's Sudafed PE Cold and Cough is a combination medicine that relieves multiple cold symptoms. It's good to use if your child has a stuffy nose and a cough.

The decongestant (Phenylephrine) has fewer side effects than other decongestants like Pseudoephedrine. It doesn't raise your child's blood pressure and heart rate as much, or cause as much trouble falling asleep.
Can be helpful in relieving congestion-related headaches and pressure in your child's ears.

upsides_processed.orig: Children's Sudafed PE Cold and Cough is a combination medicine that relieves multiple cold symptoms. It's good to use if your child has a stuffy nose and a cough.

Can be helpful in relieving congestion-related headaches and pressure in your child's ears.

names_brand: Children's Sudafed PE Cold and Cough

risks_warnings.title: High blood pressure
risks_warnings.description: Children's Sudafed PE Cold and Cough works by narrowing blood vessels. It can cause or worsen high blood pressure. If your child complains about being dizzy or having a headache that won't go away, Children's Sudafed PE Cold and Cough might not be the best option for him/her.

description_processed.orig: Children's Sudafed PE Cold and Cough works by narrowing blood vessels. It can cause or worsen high blood pressure. If your child complains about being dizzy or having a headache that won't go away, Children's Sudafed PE Cold and Cough might not be the best option for him/her.

risks_warnings.title: Heart problems
risks_warnings.description: The stimulant effect of Children's Sudafed PE Cold and Cough can make your child's heart work harder than it can handle. Be careful if he/she have a history of heart conditions. Talk to your child's doctor to find out if another option might be better for him/her.

description_processed.orig: The stimulant effect of Children's Sudafed PE Cold and Cough can make your child's heart work harder than it can handle. Be careful if he/she have a history of heart conditions. Talk to your child's doctor to find out if another option might be better for him/her.

risks_warnings.title: Seizures
risks_warnings.description: Children's Sudafed PE Cold and Cough can lower the brain's threshold for seizures in people with certain risk factors. Use with caution if your child has a history of seizures.

description_processed.orig: Children's Sudafed PE Cold and Cough can lower the brain's threshold for seizures in people with certain risk factors. Use with caution if your child has a history of seizures.

risks_warnings.title: Chronic cough from an infection
risks_warnings.description: Let your doctor know if your child has asthma or reactive airway disease before using Children's Sudafed PE Cold and Cough. Make sure to tell your child's doctor if his/her cough doesn't go away after a week or comes back after getting better, especially if he/she is coughing up significantly more mucus (phlegm) or has a fever. All this can be signs of a more serious infection.
risk_factors: Cough that happens frequently or with fever and lots of mucus

carousel_items: Use 1 to 2 lozenges every 2 hours as you need to for sore throat and cough.
Since the lozenges could be mistaken for candy and can be a choking hazard, keep these away from children who are younger than 6 years old.
If you experience any uncomfortable burning or stinging, stop using Chloraseptic Total Sore Throat and Cough Lozenges.
Let your doctor know if you have an infection and your symptoms don’t get better after a few days.

basics.benefits_moa: Chloraseptic Total Sore Throat and Cough Lozenges have three types of medication. Benzocaine creates a numbing sensation that relieves pain. Menthol creates a cooling sensation that distracts you from feeling pain. Dextromethorphan is a cough suppressant.
basics.bottom_line: Chloraseptic Total Sore Throat and Cough Lozenges relieve sore throat pain and cough well.
downsides: These lozenges don’t cure infections or colds, but they help relieve some of their symptoms.
Pain relief doesn't last long, so use a new lozenge every 2 hours as needed.
Can’t be used for children who are younger than 6 years old.
Can cause more side effects than other cough drops or lozenges since it has a cough suppressant in it.

downsides_processed.orig: These lozenges don’t cure infections or colds, but they help relieve some of their symptoms.
Pain relief doesn't last long, so use a new lozenge every 2 hours as needed.
Can’t be used for children who are younger than 6 years old.
Can cause more side effects than other cough drops or lozenges since it has a cough suppressant in it.

upsides: Chloraseptic Total Sore Throat and Cough Lozenges are effective at relieving pain in the mouth and throat. They start working right away, so you don’t have to wait long to feel better.
Have three medicines in one lozenge that work in different ways to provide pain and cough relief.
Comes in a sugar-free form.

names_brand: Chloraseptic Total Sore Throat and Cough Lozenge

risks_warnings.title: Sore throat warning
risks_warnings.description: If your sore throat gets worse or you begin to have a high fever, headache, nausea, or vomiting, talk to your doctor since these could all be signs of a worsening infection.

description_processed.orig: If your sore throat gets worse or you begin to have a high fever, headache, nausea, or vomiting, talk to your doctor since these could all be signs of a worsening infection.

risks_warnings.title: Serotonin syndrome
risks_warnings.description: Serotonin syndrome is a rare but potentially life-threatening condition when there's too much serotonin in the brain. The dextromethorphan in Chloraseptic Total Sore Throat and Cough Lozenges, when used with other medicines that affect serotonin (antidepressants, lithium, triptans, St. John's wort), increases your risk for serotonin syndrome. Symptoms include fast heart rate, sweating, muscle stiffness or spasms, fever, and confusion. Get medical attention right away if you have these symptoms.
risk_factors: Using other medications that affect serotonin

description_processed.orig: Serotonin syndrome is a rare but potentially life-threatening condition when there's too much serotonin in the brain. The dextromethorphan in Chloraseptic Total Sore Throat and Cough Lozenges, when used with other medicines that affect serotonin (antidepressants, lithium, triptans, St. John's wort), increases your risk for serotonin syndrome. Symptoms include fast heart rate, sweating, muscle stiffness or spasms, fever, and confusion. Get medical attention right away if you have these symptoms.

risks_warnings.title: Abnormal blood levels of methemoglobin (Methemoglobinemia)
risks_warnings.description: Chloraseptic Total Sore Throat and Cough Lozenges has been linked to methemoglobinemia, a very serious condition that occurs when there are high levels of methemoglobin in your blood. Too much methemoglobin leads to less oxygen that can be delivered to your tissues, and this can be life-threatening. This reaction’s very rare and mostly occurs in young children. Seek medical attention immediately if you start having symptoms such as a fast heartbeat, confusion, cyanosis (turning blue), dizziness, or trouble breathing.
risk_factors: Using Chloraseptic Total Sore Throat and Cough Lozenges at a higher dose and longer than recommended l History of smoking and breathing problems

carousel_items: Cough suppressant starts working in 15 to 30 minutes.
Follow age-specific dosing instructions on how much to take. Don't take more than the recommended dose.
If your cough lasts more than 7 days, call your doctor.

basics.bottom_line: Dextromethorphan is a good option for treating dry cough. It's not safe to take with MAO inhibitors though.
downsides: Can't take dextromethorphan if you're taking MAO inhibitors (drugs used to treat Parkinson's disease, depression, and other emotional conditions). If taken together, they will cause dangerously high blood pressure levels.
If you're taking this in combination with other cold and allergy medications, you should read labels closely to make sure you're not accidentally taking too much of a single ingredient.

downsides_processed.orig: Can't take dextromethorphan if you're taking MAO inhibitors (drugs used to treat Parkinson's disease, depression, and other emotional conditions). If taken together, they will cause dangerously high blood pressure levels.
If you're taking this in combination with other cold and allergy medications, you should read labels closely to make sure you're not accidentally taking too much of a single ingredient.

upsides: Good for treating dry cough.
Available in drugstores either by itself or in combination with other medications to treat cold and allergy symptoms.
Available as a liquid and a tablet.
Some products relieve cough for up to 12 hours.

carousel_items: Cough suppressant starts working in 15 to 30 minutes.
Follow age-specific dosing instructions on how much to take. Don't take more than the recommended dose.
Drink plenty of fluids while taking Mucinex DM because liquid helps break down mucus.
If your cough lasts more than 7 days, call your doctor.

basics.benefits_moa: Mucinex DM is a combination medicine. Guaifenesin is an expectorant that breaks up and thins out mucus. Dextromethorphan is a cough suppressant.
basics.bottom_line: Mucinex DM is okay for loosening congestion in your chest and throat, but it could prevent you from coughing the mucus up. It comes as an extended-release tablet and a short-acting liquid.
downsides: Mucinex DM isn’t useful if you have a dry cough without mucus or phlegm.
The two medications in this product could potentially work against each other. Guaifenesin makes mucus easier to cough up, while dextromethorphan (the "DM" in Mucinex DM) stops you from coughing.
Can cause sleepiness, dizziness, and an upset stomach.

downsides_processed.orig: Mucinex DM isn’t useful if you have a dry cough without mucus or phlegm.
The two medications in this product could potentially work against each other. Guaifenesin makes mucus easier to cough up, while dextromethorphan (the "DM" in Mucinex DM) stops you from coughing.
Can cause sleepiness, dizziness, and an upset stomach.

upsides: Mucinex DM is a combination medicine that relieves multiple cold symptoms. It's good to use if you have chest congestion and a cough.
Helps loosen the mucus and phlegm that builds up in productive and wet coughs.
The extended release version of Mucinex DM lasts up to 12 hours.

upsides_processed.orig: Mucinex DM is a combination medicine that relieves multiple cold symptoms. It's good to use if you have chest congestion and a cough.
Helps loosen the mucus and phlegm that builds up in productive and wet coughs.
The extended release version of Mucinex DM lasts up to 12 hours.

drugs.one_liner: Breaks up mucus and relieves cough.

userStories.tip: Last winter I had this problem where when I would lay down to sleep I would start coughing. I took this and 20 minutes later I laid down - no coughing. After a week or so the problem went away. Came back again later and this helped again.

I always use this and nasal irrigation to break up mucus. Extremely effective. Best to avoid taking before you are about to do any strenuous or highly social activity - or at least have a lot of tissues on hand.

risks_warnings.title: Nausea and vomiting
risks_warnings.description: People taking Mucinex DM have reported nausea and vomiting. This is very rare and usually not serious. If you develop a fever with the nausea and vomiting, then talk to your doctor right away.

Symptoms include fast heart rate, sweating, muscle stiffness or spasms, fever, and confusion. Get medical attention right away if you have these symptoms.

risks_warnings.description: Stop using Mucinex DM and talk to a doctor if your cough lasts more than 7 days, has too much mucus, comes back, or if you begin to have a fever, rash, or continuous headache. These signs could mean you have a more serious infection or problem.

basics.bottom_line: Robitussin DM is okay for loosening congestion in your chest and throat, but it could prevent you from coughing the mucus up. You have to take it more often than other guaifenesin products.
downsides: Robitussin DM isn’t useful if you have a dry cough without mucus or phlegm.
The two medications in this product could potentially work against each other. Guaifenesin makes mucus easier to cough up, while dextromethorphan (the "DM" in Robitussin DM) stops you from coughing.
Needs to be taken more often during the day than other products with guaifenesin, like Mucinex.
Can cause sleepiness, dizziness, and an upset stomach.

carousel_items: Doxylamine, the antihistamine ingredient, makes you tired so take it before you go to sleep.
Dextromethorphan, the cough suppressant ingredient, starts working in 15 to 30 minutes.
Don't take it with alcohol or other drugs that make you sleepy.
Follow age-specific dosing instructions on how much to take. Don't take more than the recommended dose.
If you get the liquid form, use the dosing cup to measure the exact amount of medicine you need.
If your cough lasts more than 7 days, talk with your doctor. A different medication might work better for you.

basics.benefits_moa: Robitussin Nighttime Cough DM is a combination medicine that treats cold symptoms. Doxylamine is an antihistamine that relieves a runny nose and makes you very sleepy. Dextromethorphan is a cough suppressant.
basics.bottom_line: Robitussin Nighttime Cough DM can help you get a good night's sleep and stop coughing, but you can have a hard time waking up if you don't give yourself enough time to sleep.
downsides: Shouldn't be used unless you have a full night to sleep.
You shouldn't drive after taking it until you know how it affects you.
Drinking alcohol while taking this medicine isn't recommended.
It can increase the risk of falls, so elderly people shouldn't use Robitussin Nighttime Cough DM.

Can't use dextromethorphan if you're taking MAO inhibitors (drugs used to treat Parkinson's disease, depression, and other emotional conditions). If taken together, they will cause dangerously high blood pressure levels.

downsides_processed.orig: Shouldn't be used unless you have a full night to sleep.
You shouldn't drive after taking it until you know how it affects you.
Drinking alcohol while taking this medicine isn't recommended.
It can increase the risk of falls, so elderly people shouldn't use Robitussin Nighttime Cough DM.

Can't use dextromethorphan if you're taking MAO inhibitors (drugs used to treat Parkinson's disease, depression, and other emotional conditions). If taken together, they will cause dangerously high blood pressure levels.

upsides: Robitussin Nighttime Cough DM is a combination medicine that relieves multiple cold symptoms. It's good to use if you have watery eyes, sneezing, and a cough.
The antihistamine (doxylamine) helps you fall asleep and doesn't make you feel groggy the next morning.
The cough medicine (dextromethorphan) works well and has very few side effects.
Can be used for people 12 years and older.

upsides_processed.orig: Robitussin Nighttime Cough DM is a combination medicine that relieves multiple cold symptoms. It's good to use if you have watery eyes, sneezing, and a cough.
The antihistamine (doxylamine) helps you fall asleep and doesn't make you feel groggy the next morning.
The cough medicine (dextromethorphan) works well and has very few side effects.
Can be used for people 12 years and older.

drugs.one_liner: Relieves cough and helps you sleep.

alternatives.name: Alka-Seltzer Plus Night Severe Cold and Flu

userStories.tip: Works so well, a lil hungover feeling tho in the morning. Make sure you have some coffee around. Haha

drugs.name: Robitussin Nighttime Cough DM

carousel_items_processed.orig: Doxylamine, the antihistamine ingredient, makes you tired so take it before you go to sleep.
Dextromethorphan, the cough suppressant ingredient, starts working in 15 to 30 minutes.
Don't take it with alcohol or other drugs that make you sleepy.
Follow age-specific dosing instructions on how much to take. Don't take more than the recommended dose.
If you get the liquid form, use the dosing cup to measure the exact amount of medicine you need.
If your cough lasts more than 7 days, talk with your doctor. A different medication might work better for you.

names_brand: Robitussin Maximum Strength Nighttime Cough DM
names_for_query: Robitussin Maximum Strength Nighttime Cough DM

carousel_items: Carry your rescue inhaler with you at all times to stop an asthma attack.
Wait at least one minute between sprays.
Wash the mouthpiece at least once a week.
Talk to your doctor if you're using this more than prescribed or expected.
Can cause heart racing, headache, and chest pain.
If you're having to use your rescue inhaler more than twice a week, you might need an additional medication to control your asthma better.

basics.benefits_moa: Albuterol is a bronchodilator. It relaxes the muscles that tighten your lungs during an asthma attack. This opens airways and makes breathing easier.
basics.bottom_line: Albuterol is good at stopping asthma attacks and helping you breathe.
downsides: Can make your heart race temporarily.

downsides_processed.orig: Can make your heart race temporarily.

upsides: Stops asthma attacks.
Can also help prevent asthma attacks caused by exercise.
While there are technically no generic versions of Albuterol, there are many competing brands, which keeps prices pretty low.

upsides_processed.orig: Stops asthma attacks.
Can also help prevent asthma attacks caused by exercise.
While there are technically no generic versions of Albuterol, there are many competing brands, which keeps prices pretty low.

userStories.tip: You may need a longer acting inhaler
I found Symbicort far better as a longer acting preventor and not as much ventolin required with that.
Take it in the morning if you can. If you take it at night, there's a chance that your heart will beat faster inducing insomnia.
Take if after interaction with cat or when sick with chest cold.

Wash the mouthpiece at least once a week.
Talk to your doctor if you're using this more than prescribed or expected.
Can cause heart racing, headache, and chest pain.

risks_warnings.title: Worsening of asthma attack
risks_warnings.description: Rare reports of worsening asthma attacks have been reported when people start a new canister of Albuterol for the first time. If this happens, call 911 or your doctor immediately.
risk_factors: Using new canister for the first time

description_processed.orig: Rare reports of worsening asthma attacks have been reported when people start a new canister of Albuterol for the first time. If this happens, call 911 or your doctor immediately.

risks_warnings.title: Worsening asthma
risks_warnings.description: If you find that you are having to use Albuterol more often to control your asthma, talk to your doctor as they may need to consider alternative or added therapies.

description_processed.orig: If you find that you are having to use Albuterol more often to control your asthma, talk to your doctor as they may need to consider alternative or added therapies.

risks_warnings.title: Increased risk for colds and flu
risks_warnings.description: People on Albuterol have reported getting colds and the flu more often. If this bothers you, talk to your doctor.

description_processed.orig: People on Albuterol have reported getting colds and the flu more often. If this bothers you, talk to your doctor.

points.name: Hoarseness
points.hlt: upper respiratory tract signs and symptoms

carousel_items: It’s available in different dosage forms. Tussionex suspension and TussiCaps capsules are long-acting and dosed every 12 hours, while Vituz is short-acting and dosed every 4 to 6 hours as needed.
Can make you dizzy or drowsy, so avoid activities where you need to be fully alert until you know how it affects you.
To prevent taking too much, use the oral syringe that comes with the solution and don’t use a household teaspoon or tablespoon.
Constipation is common, so drink lots of water and use stool softeners if necessary.
Use it for the shortest time possible, since it can cause dependence.

basics.benefits_moa: Hydrocodone/Chlorpheniramine is a combination medicine that treats cough, allergy, and cold symptoms. Hydrocodone is an opioid (similar to codeine) that relieves pain and works in the brain to control cough. Chlorpheniramine (an antihistamine) treats nasal allergy symptoms.
basics.bottom_line: Hydrocodone/Chlorpheniramine works well to relieve cough and allergy or cold symptoms, but since it's a schedule II (CII) drug, you’ll have to go back to the doctor if you need a refill.
downsides: Hydrocodone/Chlorpheniramine is a controlled substance (CII) because it contains hydrocodone, a medicine with a high risk of abuse. You'll need to keep it in a safe place to avoid it being taken by others.
Constipation is very common, so you'll need to drink enough water and stool softeners while on it.
All opioid medicines have the risk of causing physical dependence and withdrawal when you stop using it.
None of the dosage forms of Hydrocodone/Chlorpheniramine are safe to give to children younger than 6 years. It can cause really slow breathing in children that can lead to death.

downsides_processed.orig: Hydrocodone/Chlorpheniramine is a controlled substance (CII) because it contains hydrocodone, a medicine with a high risk of abuse. You'll need to keep it in a safe place to avoid it being taken by others.
Constipation is very common, so you'll need to drink enough water and stool softeners while on it.
All opioid medicines have the risk of causing physical dependence and withdrawal when you stop using it.
None of the dosage forms of Hydrocodone/Chlorpheniramine are safe to give to children younger than 6 years. It can cause really slow breathing in children that can lead to death.

upsides: Hydrocodone/Chlorpheniramine is a combination opioid (hydrocodone) and antihistamine (chlorpheniramine) medicine that relieves cough and upper respiratory (nose, throat, and sinus) symptoms.
The long-acting forms (suspension and capsule) are best if you need all-day relief. The shorter acting solution is a good choice if you need it to work faster.
In addition to relieving your cough, it may help you fall asleep easier.
The antihistamine, chlorpheniramine, can help dry out your nose and prevent cough from post-nasal drip.

upsides_processed.orig: Hydrocodone/Chlorpheniramine is a combination opioid (hydrocodone) and antihistamine (chlorpheniramine) medicine that relieves cough and upper respiratory (nose, throat, and sinus) symptoms.
The long-acting forms (suspension and capsule) are best if you need all-day relief. The shorter acting solution is a good choice if you need it to work faster.
In addition to relieving your cough, it may help you fall asleep easier.
The antihistamine, chlorpheniramine, can help dry out your nose and prevent cough from post-nasal drip.

userStories.tip: You have to take the dosage exactly.  I have found this is the only product that will work for me when I have a cough.  It allows me to sleep through the night where no other cough medicine has helped.

drugs.name: Hydrocodone chlorpheniramine

carousel_items_processed.orig: It’s available in different dosage forms. Tussionex suspension and TussiCaps capsules are long-acting and dosed every 12 hours, while Vituz is short-acting and dosed every 4 to 6 hours as needed.
Can make you dizzy or drowsy, so avoid activities where you need to be fully alert until you know how it affects you.
To prevent taking too much, use the oral syringe that comes with the solution and don’t use a household teaspoon or tablespoon.
Constipation is common, so drink lots of water and use stool softeners if necessary.
Use it for the shortest time possible, since it can cause dependence.

risks_warnings.title: Inability to breathe
risks_warnings.description: Taking too much Hydrocodone/Chlorpheniramine can cause irregular or slow breathing that can put you in a coma and can cause death. TussiCaps should be swallowed whole, don't ever crush or chew. Don't take more than 2 doses Tussionex or TussiCaps in a 24 hour period. If your lips and fingers start turning blue from low oxygen, see a doctor immediately. In the hospital, doctors can give you a medicine that reverses the effects of Hydrocodone/Chlorpheniramine. Don't take more than your doctor prescribes. Always check with your doctor before starting any new medicines or supplements.
risk_factors: Current use of medicine that affects liver enzyme CYP 3A4

description_processed.orig: Taking too much Hydrocodone/Chlorpheniramine can cause irregular or slow breathing that can put you in a coma and can cause death. TussiCaps should be swallowed whole, don't ever crush or chew. Don't take more than 2 doses Tussionex or TussiCaps in a 24 hour period. If your lips and fingers start turning blue from low oxygen, see a doctor immediately. In the hospital, doctors can give you a medicine that reverses the effects of Hydrocodone/Chlorpheniramine. Don't take more than your doctor prescribes. Always check with your doctor before starting any new medicines or supplements.

risks_warnings.title: Driving impairment
risks_warnings.description: Hydrocodone/Chlorpheniramine lowers your ability to focus, think, and react. Be careful and avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medication affects you.
risk_factors: Taking other medicines that make you less alert

description_processed.orig: Hydrocodone/Chlorpheniramine lowers your ability to focus, think, and react. Be careful and avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medication affects you.

risks_warnings.title: Intestinal problems and blockage
risks_warnings.description: Taking medicines that contain opioids like Hydrocodone/Chlorpheniramine can cause intestinal problems. People with intestinal movement problems are at higher risk of obstruction (blockage) when taking medicines that contain both an opioid and antihistamine, both of which reduce movement in the intestine. Let your doctor know if you have any intestinal problems or severe constipation before taking Hydrocodone/Chlorpheniramine.

description_processed.orig: Taking medicines that contain opioids like Hydrocodone/Chlorpheniramine can cause intestinal problems. People with intestinal movement problems are at higher risk of obstruction (blockage) when taking medicines that contain both an opioid and antihistamine, both of which reduce movement in the intestine. Let your doctor know if you have any intestinal problems or severe constipation before taking Hydrocodone/Chlorpheniramine.

risks_warnings.title: Death in newborn babies from opioid withdrawal (Neonatal opioid withdrawal syndrome)
risks_warnings.description: Hydrocodone/Chlorpheniramine passes into breast milk. Women with a history of long-term opioid use increase the risk of neonatal withdrawal syndrome. Symptoms in the newborn include irritability, vomiting, diarrhea, tremor, and lack of weight gain. Opioid withdrawal in infants is a life-threatening emergency and needs immediate medical care.

description_processed.orig: Hydrocodone/Chlorpheniramine passes into breast milk. Women with a history of long-term opioid use increase the risk of neonatal withdrawal syndrome. Symptoms in the newborn include irritability, vomiting, diarrhea, tremor, and lack of weight gain. Opioid withdrawal in infants is a life-threatening emergency and needs immediate medical care.

risks_warnings.title: Death from overdose
risks_warnings.description: Even one dose of Hydrocodone/Chlorpheniramine can be too much a child younger than 6 years. Keep the medicine out of their reach. If you suspect your child has taken Hydrocodone/Chlorpheniramine, watch for decreased activity, extreme tiredness, and lips and fingers turning blue from low oxygen. Go to a hospital immediately and the doctors can give a medicine that reverses the effects of Hydrocodone/Chlorpheniramine.

description_processed.orig: Even one dose of Hydrocodone/Chlorpheniramine can be too much a child younger than 6 years. Keep the medicine out of their reach. If you suspect your child has taken Hydrocodone/Chlorpheniramine, watch for decreased activity, extreme tiredness, and lips and fingers turning blue from low oxygen. Go to a hospital immediately and the doctors can give a medicine that reverses the effects of Hydrocodone/Chlorpheniramine.

risks_warnings.title: Abuse, tolerance, and addiction
risks_warnings.description: Long-acting opioids like Hydrocodone/Chlorpheniramine have a greater risk of addiction, abuse, misuse, overdose, and death. Your body can develop tolerance to Hydrocodone/Chlorpheniramine, which means that more medicine is needed to treat your symptoms. All opioid containing medicines have the risk of physical dependence and withdrawal when stopping the medicine if you use them for a long time. It’s more likely if you continue to take Hydrocodone/Chlorpheniramine for more than a few days so take the lowest dose possible for only as long as you need it. You can avoid withdrawal by weaning off of the medication very slowly and taking the exact dose your doctor prescribed. People taking Hydrocodone/Chlorpheniramine with a history of drug abuse should ask their doctor about other medicine choices.
risk_factors: Taking more than the prescribed dose
History of drug abuse or mental illness.
